label: ID
description: This field stores the four-character ID that identifies the Bankruptcy record. The bankruptcy ID is assigned when creating the Bankruptcy record.

label: DESCRIPTION
description: You cannot create a Bankruptcy record without entering a description. If you leave the field blank, an error message appears, and you cannot save the Bankruptcy record until you have entered a description.

label: TYPE
description: This field stores the reason for the Bankruptcy record.

label: OPENDATE
description: The system updates this field with the system date when the Bankruptcy record is created.

label: CLOSEDATE
description: This field stores the date when the Bankruptcy record is closed.

label: RECORDCHANGEDATE
description: This field stores the system date when you create, change, or save the Bankruptcy record.

label: EFFECTDATE
description: This field stores the date the bankruptcy begins, or takes effect.

label: EXPIREDATE
description: This field stores the date the bankruptcy expires, or is no longer in effect.
